page.title: 14THE CARAVAN SITE, BERKELEY
page.content: The{caravan site}was first inhabited by contractors building{Berkeley Power {Station}in 1954/55. By 1962 the site had changed hands and a more general range of people lived there. The caravans were given more{substantial {bases}in the early 1970's. This led to the site being considered as a more permanent place to live. 1978 saw the site expanded to three large fields. The caravans, some now{twin-units,}now number over 100 and are usually advertised as{retirement homes.}This means the site population tends to be made up of the older age groups. During the{winter}this type of home is prone to being shaken and rattled by stormy winds and during the{summer months they tend to get rather hot and stuffy.{Amenities}on the site include a general store and play areas for the younger inhabitants.
